greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Heinz number of the run-lengths of the divisors of n.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition or multiset {y_1,...,y_k} is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
maple: Splitting the divisors of 30 into runs gives {{1, 2, 3}, {5, 6}, {10}, {15}, {30}}, and the Heinz number of {1, 1, 1, 2, 3} is 120, so a(30) = 120.
xref: The longest run of divisors of n has length A055874(n).
Numbers whose divisors > 1 have no non-singleton runs are A088725.
The number of successive pairs of divisors of n is A129308(n).
The Heinz number of the set of divisors of n is A275700(n).
Numbers whose divisors do not have weakly decreasing run-lengths are A328165.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 07 2019
